quickstart.title: Any other type of data
quickstart.header: Including files, databases, data stored on remote machines, or any other type of data you'd like to put in Splunk.

optiongroup.title: Use one of the following standard Splunk data inputs to add your data to Splunk:

option.title: Files and directories
option.summary: Configure Splunk to continously index a directory of files, or upload an archived directory.

option.title: TCP
option.summary: Configure Splunk to listen on a port for data sent using TCP.

option.title: UDP
option.summary: Configure Splunk to listen on a port for data sent using UDP.

optiongroup.title: Splunk can get data from other machines and devices
optiongroup.header: Sometimes you have data you want to get into Splunk that your Splunk server doesn't have direct access to. In this case, use Splunk forwarders to send data from any machine to your Splunk server. Forwarders are lightweight, free and can be deployed on any machine you want to capture data from.

option.title: Data sources on machines your Splunk server can't access
option.summary: Use Splunk's universal forwarder to forward data from any machine to your Splunk server.

optiongroup.title: Splunk can programatically consume data from databases, APIs and services
optiongroup.header: Connect to any API, database or service with a script. Configure Splunk to run and collect the output.

option.title: Use scripted inputs to consume data from anything you can connect to programmatically
option.summary: Write your own script to get data into Splunk from any API, command, database query and more.

optiongroup.title: Use apps and add-ons to get your data into Splunk
optiongroup.header: Splunk will index any type of data, but you might want a solution for a specific type of data. Apps and add-ons contain searches, reports, inputs and more for your specific data type. Try out as many different apps and add-ons as you like.

option.title: Download apps and add-ons from SplunkApps
option.summary: Browse SplunkApps for solutions specific to your type of data and use case.
